law.catch_line: Delivery of property by former trustee.

text.section: Unless a cotrustee remains in office or the court otherwise orders, and until the trust property is delivered to a successor trustee or other person entitled to it, a trustee who has resigned or been removed has the duties of a trustee and the powers necessary to protect the trust property.

A trustee who has resigned or been removed shall proceed expeditiously to deliver the trust property within the trusteeâ€™s possession to the cotrustee, successor trustee, or other person entitled to it.

law.history: Created 2014 Ky. Acts ch. 25, sec. 56, effective July 15, 2014.
